resources.string: Are you sure that you want to skip this questionnaire? You can fill it out later.
The data collection runs only during conference hours and does not collect during the night.

Thank you for participating in the UbiComp 2013 data collection campaign. This application aims to collect Bluetooth and Wi-Fi scans in order to analyze differences in the mobility behavior between individuals and groups of scientists. The initial questionnaire is used to analyze differences in the mobility behavior between individuals and groups of the participants. The buttons allow to control the collection service. All the collected data will be transmitted to a remote server periodically and only when the Wi-Fi connection is established. The background service runs between 8am and 6pm on conference days to ensure the privacy issues.
Please let us know a bit more about you. Filling the questionnaire is optional but it will double your chances to win the Amazon vouchers!
Please let us know a bit more about you. Filling the questionnaire is optional but it will double your chances to win the Amazon vouchers!

To participate in the raffle for three Amazon vouchers of 100.- USD each and to get early access to the data, just send us your e-mail using the button below. You will be able to register after the app will have collected data for at least 40% of the conference hours. IMPORTANT: Your e-mail address will not be linked to your data to guarantee your anonymity!

To participate in the raffle for three Amazon vouchers of 100.- USD each and to get early access to the data, just send us your e-mail using the button below. You will be able to register after the app will have collected data for at least 40% of the conference hours. IMPORTANT: Your e-mail address will not be linked to your data to guarantee your anonymity! Thank you for submitting your registration for receiving the data set. Your registration will be uploaded to the remote server as soon as possible.

To participate in the raffle for three Amazon vouchers of 100.- USD each and to get early access to the data, just send us your e-mail using the button below. You will be able to register after the app will have collected data for at least 40% of the conference hours. IMPORTANT: Your e-mail address will not be linked to your data to guarantee your anonymity! Thank you for submitting your registration for receiving the data set. Your registration has been uploaded to the remote server.

To participate in the raffle for three Amazon vouchers of 100.- USD each and to get early access to the data, just send us your e-mail using the button below. You will be able to register after the app will have collected data for at least 40% of the conference hours. IMPORTANT: Your e-mail address will not be linked to your data to guarantee your anonymity!
Congratulation! You have unlocked the registration for the data set!
You are now collecting data for the UbiComp 2013 Data Collection Campaign (DCC). Thank you for your participation!
Please provide a valid email address
Welcome to the UbiComp 2013 Data Collection Campaign (DCC)

What is the UbiComp 2013 DCC application?
 This application allows you to participate in the UbiComp 2013 Data Collection Campaign – UbiComp 2013 DCC for short. The goal of the UbiComp 2013 DCC is to gather mobility traces of individuals in indoor environments.


Which data is collected?
 The app scans regularly for visible Wi-Fi access points and Bluetooth devices and logs their identifiers (along with a timestamp). The data is stored on the phone first and offloaded to a remote server whenever a Wi-Fi connection is available.


When is the data collected?
 The app will run during the whole UbiComp 2013 conference. However, it will actually only record its data during the official “conference hours” – from the start of the first session until the end of the last session of each day. The rest of the time the app just sleeps. You can of course manually suspend all tracking at any time, directly in the app.


What do you plan to do with the data?
 We want to analyze individuals’ and groups’ “micro-mobility” behavior. Hopefully, enough attendees will install the app so that we can collect a valuable data set for the research community.


Is the data going to be publicly available?
 Yes, that is definitely the plan. Also, those who will help us with the collection by installing the app will get “early access” to it – as soon as we have done the initial clean-up of the data. The only catch is that we ask you to leave the app running for at least 40% of the conference hours for this. An indicator within the app will show you how close you are to that goal. As an additional incentive we will raffle three Amazon gift vouchers in the amount of 100.- USD among these participants!


How do you know where to send my voucher to?
 Once you reach that 40% goal, you will be able to submit your e-mail address directly in the app. This will allow you to participate in the raffle and to be included in the “early access” list.


Who are the organizers of the UbiComp 2013 DCC?
 The UbiComp 2013 DCC is a joint project of the 
 Wireless Sensor Networks Lab (WSN Lab) and 
 Multimedia Communication Lab (KOM) of
 TU Darmstadt, Germany and the 


Distributed Systems Group (DS Group) of 
 ETH Zurich, Switzerland. 


The team is composed of 
 Paul Baumann, Johannes Klaus, and
Silvia Santini (WSN Lab), 
 Bjoern Richerzhagen (KOM), and 
 Wilhelm Kleiminger (DS Group).


Should you have any questions, please contact us: ubidcc@wsn.tu-darmstadt.de
 More information: www.wsn.tu-darmstadt.de/ubidcc
Set username and password in settings to manage online your already uploaded data.
Visit website to manage your already uploaded data.
The data is finally deleted from database for privacy purposes
